title: 83x1: 18 U.S.C. § 205's Exception for Testimony Under Oath
summary:
The exception in 18 U.S.C. § 205 for "testimony under oath" would permit a present employee of the U.S. Government to serve as an expert witness for the plaintiff even though the United States was a defendant-in-chief. However, it is OGE's position that the standards of conduct, would prohibit such testimony.  

Notes: [cites former 5 C.F.R. § 735.201]
